Content-Type: text/plain;
	charset=utf-8

Very interesting! Thanks for doing the experiments and letting us know!

Be=
st regards,
Jeff Clune

Loy and Edith Harris Associate Professor in Compute=
r Science
Director, Evolving Artificial Intelligence Lab <http://evolvingai=
.org/>
University of Wyoming
jeffclune@... <mailto:jeffclune@...>=

jeffclune.com <http://jeffclune.com/>
> On Sep 17, 2017, at 10:04 PM, stef=
ano.r.palmieri@... [neat] <neat@yahoogroups.com> wrote:
> 
> Jeff, 
>=
 
> I've rerun the Retina Task experiments using logistic units instead of =
ReLus for the K^2 Graph. I expect my findings to be similar for HyperNEAT a=
nd ES-HyperNEAT. Note that in these experiments the number of evaluations a=
re held constant and that this task has somewhat high complexity (what you =
asked for).
> 
> All parameters were kept exactly the same in my previous R=
etina Task experiments.
> 
> I have 2 trials pending out of 40 but so far o=
ut of 38 trials, 17 trials came up with a solution. That's lower than the s=
uccess rate with ReLus (50% vs 62.5%). I'm not exactly sure how to do signi=
ficance testing yet but I will post the raw data tomorrow when the last 2 t=
rials finish.
> 
> The wall clock time was very very long compared to using=
 ReLus. I don't know if it's a problem with my implementation or scipy bein=
g slow with sigmoid. 
> 
> This pretty much confirms what I thought going i=
n and why I initially did all the K^2 Graph experiments using ReLus or Leak=
y ReLus. I also vaguely remember that when I started learning about NE and =
was messing with neat-python that I could usually solve gym.openai experime=
nts using just ReLus and Identity functions.
> 
> One thing that I'm still =
curious about is how ES-HyperNEAT with LEO and Geometry seed would fare usi=
ng ReLus instead of sigmoid. I asked Sebastian and he doesn't know either.
=
> 
> So basically we need to consider that ReLu can possibly beat Sigmoid i=
n wall clock time and in generation time. Somehow, I don't find that very s=
urprising and I doubt that our friends in DL would be surprised either.
> 
=
> 


--Apple-Mail=_24F7B26F-85FB-48D5-B434-8D93A14325FD
